Description: Vessel sherd; earthenware; red and grey fabric; exterior decorated with horizontal, diagonal and semi-circular bands, and a number of discs; all painted in shades of brown on buff. Red-brown organic Nile silt with black core and abundant mica, organic and white inclusions
Curator's comments: See decorative motiefs used at Karanis (Johnson 1981, pl.13, nos 107-8, 4th to mid 5th century AD). Johnson. B. 1981. Pottery From Karanis: Excavations of the University of Michigan. Kelsey Museum of Archaeology Studies, vol. 7. Ann Arbor: University of Michigan Press.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IE.16) (Phase 3)
